name: Skin Fetish: Sublime Perfection Blurring Under Eye Powder
about: What it is:Â An innovative baked under-eye powder that blurs, smooths and perfects while setting concealer in place...Coverage:Â Light.Finish:Â Radiant.Formulation:Â Pressed Powder..What Else You Need to Know: Your photoready secret weapon. This feather-light setting powder is formulated specifically for the delicate under-eye area. Available in five shades, the baked powder blurs fine lines, smooths texture, Â and perfects instantly and invisibly, without building up on skin.
ingredients: Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Silica, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Octyldodecyl Stearoyl Stearate, Mica, Zea Mays (Corn) Starch, Serica (Silk) Powder, Dehydroacetic Acid, Glyceryl Caprylate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Xanthan Gum, Aluminum Hydroxide, Maltodextrin, Tocopherol, Bismuth Oxychloride (CI 77163), Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Carmine (CI 75470).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.Blur & Set Effortlessly with Light/Medium/Deep .1. After applying your Concealer, add a sheer sweep of the Blurring Under-Eye Powder over the under-eye area to blur, smooth, brighten and set your concealer in place. .2. Dab on dark areas and spots with the Concealer Brush to brighten. .3. Sweep over cheekbones for a touch of subtle illumination. .4. Apply along the brow bones to achieve a natural-looking highlight. .5. To create a subtle lifted effect, apply additional Concealer and Powder starting at the outer corners of the eyes and up toward the temples, almost to the brow bones. Gently blend to a luminous finish. ...Brighten & Neutralise Instantly with Baby Pink & Yellow .1. After applying your Concealer, add a sheer sweep of the Blurring Under-Eye Powder to blur, brighten, neutralize skin tone and set your concealer in place.. .2. Dab on dark areas and spots with the Concealer Brush to brighten. .3. To create a subtle lifted effect, apply additional Concealer and Powder starting at the outer corners of the eyes and up toward the temples, almost to the brow bones. Gently blend to a luminous finish. ...Patâ€™s Backstage Tip: Use this powder anywhere on the face to smooth texture and blur away fine lines and pores. The delicate, soft-focus effect gives the skin a divine finish wherever itâ€™s applied!

Also used different brushes and that didn't help either (including a powder puff).  As a face powder, it does all that it claims to for the under eyes so I'm not mad at it. I don't need a whole lot to set the face and even though it's not a mattifying powder, it keeps my face consistent throughout the day and no extra oils push through. I have a nice dew when I initially apply and set my makeup and it looks pretty much the same by the end of the day. Very nice smoothing and blurring effect.   But $43 for a tiny little face powder? Not sure if it's worth it, especially when it doesn't work well for it's intended purpose. My Hourglass Veil powder gives me more or less the same effect (it's costs more of course, but you get almost double the product for roughly twenty bucks more).

reviews.review_text: I like this product a lot.  I am not an expert on setting powders, especially the under eye type.  I just ordered this for the second time.  I was reading some other reviews and I noticed that some people were complaining about the packaging.  I dropped this and it broke, but I think that is my fault.  I mean, I think it would be convenient if makeup was drop proof, but then it would be a lot more expensive.  So I guess I thought, charge it to the game, as it were.  if I hadn't dropped it when it was open, it wouldn't have necessarily broke.  I just think I was rushing to get ready and I messed up.  So I guess I say that to answer the complaint about the packaging.  Now that I am thinking about it, it might be nice to have this in a more substantial compact so that I could put it in my purse and do a touch up when I'm out.  I don't know, I'm still giving it a full five stars because I really like it, but I would not be upset if it came in an old school compact with a mirror and a mini brush.  Anyway,  I have light skin, not the lightest skin, I am a white person with light brown hair and eyes and I just figured I would go with the lightest shade.  I was reading the reviews to see if I should try maybe the medium shade, but I am sticking with this one for now.  I agree that this powder blurs the under eye area and it is good for dark circles.  I use it over my concealer /foundation, and it doesn't look like cakey.  If I hadn't broken it and lost it all, it would have lasted long enough to justify the price.  In my experience, Pat McGrath is worth the money, unlike lots of the really expensive stuff that is out there.  I was out of this powder this weekend and I missed it.  It is part of my must haves now if I'm going to be going out.

I have been using this powder and never looked back. It is literally the BEST. the texture is super fine and very silky. Very subtle sheer but it hides all my fine lines, and Pores. INSTANTLY.  I kid you not.  Now my under eyes looks flawless. Before this I was using Tarte but it always look cakey and dry. Now I use NARS liquid concealer and Pat blurring under eye setting powder.  Holy Grail. Buy them and Thank me later.

reviews.review_title: Had to see it for myself to believe it
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am 46 years old with slight puffiness and fine lines under my eyes. I have straight up NOT been a wearer of concealer under my eyes, because I have tried and tried, but could not find a formula with a consistency that didn't magnify my wrinkles and leave my undereye looking even drier. I first learned of this Under-Eye Setting Powder through Patty Alonso's YouTube channel, and hearing her rave about it, I figured I'd try it. My first choice, the shade Light, was out of stock, so I figured I'd try the yellow in hopes that it would neutralize some of the blue where my puffiness is. I bought this product alongside the Skin Fetish Concealer in shade L6 and the Skin Fetish Concealer brush, and had a chance to try all three out for the first time yesterday. The concealer is creamy, comfortable, and spreadable, and when I set my under-eye with this powder, it actually wasn't drying. It just created a subtle, matte blur that kept my concealer in place, crease-free, for at least 10 hours until I washed everything off. This was possibly the first time I was happy with how my undereye area looked since I was 42 and started showing signs of age. Also, I have sensitive, post-LASIK eyes, and this powder was not irritating at all. I'm going to try the Light shade, too, and will likely continue using this product for as long as it exists.

I love the size and how finely milled this is. The fact that it is truly translucent is wonderful. I tried the Kosas powder and it hard pans and transfer to masks too easily whereas this does not.
